page.title: 04FARMING-ANTINGHAM
page.content: Tavistock farm consists of 420 acres.Mr Almey farms on a medium light soil.He also has about five acres of woodland.The crops grown on the land are sugar beet,peas,beans,malting barley and wheat.Mr Almey has pigs,bullocks and horses.He has a mare and a foal.The foal is three months old and the mare is four years old.Their breed is Suffolk Punch. Mr Almey has four other horses. He has Limousin cross bullocks and alot of pigs.The horses are exported to America and Canada.The bullocks are sold on the farm.The pigs are 12 weeks old when they are sold. The farmer uses sprays to stop weeds and fungus damaging his crops.The peas and beans are grown for Aylsham Growers. The road improvements on the A149 have made life easier for the farmer.
